items.description: A variety of time series charts rendered by nvd3
items.text: Time Series Charts
The [nvd3](http://nvd3.org/) javascript library provides an good set of standard, reusable charts built on top of [d3](http://d3js.org/).

### Simple Time Series
Use like a [sparkline](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sparkline), for displaying overall trends in a high level view.

### Standard Time Series
Your basic multi-series line chart, with some nice interactive features.

### Stacked Area
Stacked graphs can be displayed in one of three modes, which can be switched interactively. Standard stacked series, [stream graphs](http://www.leebyron.com/else/streamgraph/), and a percentage view.

Stream graphs are currently only available when using the `nvd3` renderer in interactive mode.

### Single Graph
Shamelessly stolen from [Tasseo](https://github.com/obfuscurity/tasseo).

items.description: Items don't have to be confined to the fixed width grid
items.text: Breakout!

items.description: Various ways of calling out data
items.text: Text Presentations

### Single Stats
A single stat presentation shows one of the summation values that are calculated for each data series, along with a title and optionally units.

### Jumbotron Single Stat
A larger single stat suitable for big displays

### Summation Tables
Every data series returned from graphite has its min, max, sum, and mean values calculated. A summation table shows one or more of those values for each data series in the query.

### Timeshifted Summation Tables

Take any query and compare it to the past.

When evaluated, the item will take the source query and wrap it with Graphite's `timeShift()` function.

This demo uses the `collector_time_ms` metric from carbon, because the `randomWalk()` generator function doesn't work with `timeShift()`.

### Comparison Summation Tables

Like the timeshift summation table, this table compares the
difference between two queries. Instead of time-shifting one
query, however, this version comparse any two arbitrary queries.

### Percentage Table

Simply displays the sum of each series in a query as a percentage of the total.

### Markdown Text
For the inclusion of explanatory text and links.

# Heading 1
[Markdown](https://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/) is a simple plain text format for generating markup. It is rendered in a dashboard element by [marked](https://github.com/chjj/marked). 
## Heading 2
* List 
* items 
* are supported 
## Heading 3
``/* As is code */``, etc...

# Heading 1
[Markdown](https://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/) is a simple plain text format for generating markup. It is rendered in a dashboard element by [markdown-js](https://github.com/evilstreak/markdown-js). 
## Heading 2
* List 
* items 
* are supported 
## Heading 3
``/* As is code */``, etc...
Presentation Options
A variety of visual styles can be applied to structural elements (sections, rows, and cells) for visual emphasis.
Jumbotron singlestats with emphasis can get a lot of attention.

items.description: Non-time series charts, also rendered by nvd3
items.text: Other Charts

### Donuts & Pies
Often abused, occasionally useful, always tasty!

description:
Dashboard descriptions can be longer and more detailed. 
### Markdown Formatted 
Plus, they can be _formatted_ in **Markdown** format for rendering to HTML.
title: Gallery
